name: Horizontal AI
description: General-purpose AI assistants and copilots used across all functions (ChatGPT Enterprise, Microsoft 365 Copilot, Claude for Work)

name: Departmental AI
description: AI solutions built for specific job roles and departments (coding, sales, marketing, customer success, design, HR)

name: Vertical AI
description: Industry-specific AI applications targeting sectors like healthcare, legal, finance, and government

name: Model APIs
description: Foundation model inference and fine-tuning APIs that power AI applications
justification: Model APIs are the largest infrastructure spend category at $12.5B (2025), per Menlo Ventures report

name: Training & Compute
description: GPU infrastructure, training platforms, and custom silicon for model development
justification: Training infrastructure reached $4.0B (2025), essential for frontier labs and enterprise fine-tuning

name: Data / Orch. / Obs.
description: Data infrastructure, orchestration frameworks, vector databases, and observability tools for AI applications
justification: AI infrastructure reached $1.5B (2025), combining data management, orchestration, and observability
